MEANING_: Folly, Mania, Extravagance, Intoxication, Delirium, Frenzy, Bewrayment
REVERSED_: Negligence, Absence, Distribution, Carelessness, Apathy, Nullity, Vanity.
EXTRAS_: In many esoteric systems of tarot card interpretation, The fool is interpreted as the protagonist of a story, and the Major Arcana are the path the fool takes through the great mysteries of life.

MEANING_: Represents potential and tapping into one's talents. Skill, Diplomacy, Address, Sickness, Pain, Loss, Disaster, Self-Confidence, Will, The Querent Himself (if male)
REVERSED_: Potential and talents are unfocused and unmanifested. Can also be interpreted as related to black magick, madness or mental distress. Physician, Magus, Mental Ills, Disgrace, Disquiet
EXTRAS_: Associated with the planet mercury, and hence the signs of Gemini and Virgo

MEANING_: Secrets, mystery, the future as yet unrevealed. The woman that interests the Querent (if male). The Querent (if female). Silence, Tenacity, Wisdom, Science
REVERSED_: Passion, Moral or Physical Ardor, Conceit, Surface Knowledge

MEANING_: Fruitfulness, action, initiative, length of days, clandestine, the unknown, difficulty, doubt, ignorance
REVERSED_: Light, truth, the unraveling of involved matters, public rejoicings according to another reading, vacillation or hesitance

MEANING_: Authority, establishment, structure, a Father Figure. Stability, Power, Aid, Protection, A great person, Conviction, Reason
REVERSED_: Domination, Excessive Control, Lack Of Discipline, Inflexibility. Benevolence, Compassion, Credit, also confusion to enemies, obstruction, immaturity

MEANING_: Marriage, alliance, captivity, servitude, mercy and goodness, Inspiration, the man to whom the Querent has recourse
REVERSED_: Society, good understanding, concord, over kindness, weakness
EXTRAS_: In astrology, the hierophant is associated with the feminine, fixed-earth sign of Taurus and it's ruling planet, Venus

MEANING_: Attraction, Love, Beauty, Trials Overcome
REVERSED_: Failure, foolish designs. Another account speaks of marriage frustrated and contrarieties of all kinds

MEANING_: Succour, providence, also war, thriumph, presumption, vengeance, trouble
REVERSED_: Riot, quarrel, dispute, litigation, defeat

MEANING_: Power, energy, action, courage, magnanimity. also complete success and honours
REVERSED_: Despotism, abuse of power, weakness, discord, sometimes even disgrace
EXTRAS_: In astrology, the strength card is associated with the masculine, fixed-fire sign of leo and its ruling planetary body, the Sun

MEANING_: Prudence, also and specially treason. dissimulation, corruption, roguery, circumspection
REVERSED_: Concealment, Disguise, Policy Fear, Unreasoned Caution

MEANING_: Destiny, fortune, success, elevation, luck, felicity
REVERSED_: Increase, abundance, superfluity

MEANING_: Equity, rightness, probity, executive
REVERSED_: Law in all its departments, legal complications, bigotry, bias, excessive severity

MEANING_: Wisdom, circumspection, discernment, trials, sacrifice, intuition, divination, prophecy
REVERSED_: Selfishness, the crowd, body politic

MEANING_: End, mortality, destruction, corruption. Also, for a man, the loss of a benefactor, for a woman, many contrarieties, for a maid, failure of marriage projects
REVERSED_: Inertia, sleep, lethargy, petrifaction, somnambulism, hope destroyed

MEANING_: Economy, moderation, frugality, management, accommodation
REVERSED_: Things connected with churches, religions, sects, the priesthood, sometimes even the priest who will marry Querent, also dis-union, unfortunate combinations, competing interests

MEANING_: Ravage, violence, vehemence, extraordinary efforts, force, fatality. That which is predestined but is not for this reason evil
REVERSED_: Evil fatality, weakness, pettiness, blindness

MEANING_: Misery, distress, ruin, indigence, adversity, calamity, disgrace, deception. It is a card in particular of unforeseen catastrophe
REVERSED_: According to one account, the same but lesser degree. Negligence, absence, distribution, carelessness, distraction, apathy, nullity, vanity. Oppression, Imprissionment, Tyranny

MEANING_: Loss, Theft, Privation, Abandonment, although another reading suggests hope and bright prospects in the future
REVERSED_: Arrogance, haughtiness, impotence
EXTRAS_: In astrology, The Star card is associated with the planet Uranus and Aquarius zodiac sign

MEANING_: Hidden enemies, danger, calumny, darkness, terror, deception, occult forces, error
REVERSED_: Instability, inconstancy, silence, lesser degrees of deception and error
EXTRAS_: In astrology, The Moon card is associated with the mutable-water sign of Pisces and its ruling planet, Neptune

MEANING_: Material happiness, fortunate marriage, contentment
REVERSED_: The same in a lesser sense
